page.title: 10SOME ASPECTS OF HOME LIFE 1.
page.content: Home life is of a very good standard. There are no deprived or destitute persons in Hulcote or Salford. Some pensioners only just manage but are not insecure. Most families meet at breakfast which can be a cooked meal or cereal with milk, fruit, tea or coffee. Children of school age then go to school on the school bus or by car. Everyone meets again for the early evening meal.food preparation is easier today as processed foods can be purchased for quickness. Many of the villagers grow fruit and vegetables some of which can be frozen in deep freezers. There is a tendency to turn to whole foods for the sake of health. Cooking is done by electricity, some having microwave ovens.Shopping for food & household goods is done in supermarkets several miles away. Milk bread, meat & fish can be delivered.
